page.lettertext:
fol.84r
[Belgia]
1591 stilo Ro
m
17 Fe
b
to M
r
Bodly
S
r
, I receaved your lett
r
of the xij
th
the xvj
th
beinge all ready to march the
next morninge, whose councell [was held]
so houlsomme, and whose lett
r
bereth so
good credit w
th
us,
t
we are re-
solved to stay a farder directions from
S
r
John Norres
, or your self making
our selves alwayse ready att an howers
warning.
I have dispatched
captayn Gripes
to S
r
John Norres w
th
my letters to this same
effect: to whom
[.]
I have sent a coppy
of your letter, requiring his speedy aun-
swer, and farder order: thus for this
present, I leve yow to god:
Dusborgh
this xvij
th
of Februarij 1590.
Yo
r
most affectionate to do yow service Oliver Lambert.
Ther is [fivetene] passes of our wall of
[Dusborgh]
fallen downe, a sufficient breach.
[.]
3 day [.] before we apoynted to march
[.]
[.] for our money for we are
[much] behynd and in great want.
